data.title: $122 Million in Cash Found in Apartment Belonging to Acting Head of Russia's Anti-Corruption Agency
A Chinese billionaire may have hidden 6% of the world's aluminum in the Mexican desert

Facebook has deleted a post by the Norwegian prime minister in an escalating row over the website’s decision to remove content featuring the Pulitzer-prize winning “napalm girl” photograph from the Vietnam war.
The Canadian judge who asked an alleged rape victim why she 'couldn't keep her knees together' might lose his job

The Hubble telescope just discovered a relic that changes the way we understand our galaxy | The cluster is called Terzan 5 and researchers have found evidence that its stars are strikingly similar to the most ancient ones in the Milky Way -- the same as the building blocks that made up our galaxy.
'Times are changing, pay your taxes', euro zone chief tells corporations

DNA reveals giraffes are 4 species--not 1: One of the most iconic animals in Africa has a secret. A genetic analysis suggests that the giraffe is not one species, but 4 separate ones—a finding that could alter how conservationists protect these animals.
Religious groups ‘converting state schools to faith schools by back door’, MPs warned

In France, another item of clothing has become a symbol of an ongoing culture war: ...two women wearing shorts were verbally assaulted as they made their way through an eastern neighborhood in the southern city of Toulon
Facebook reverses decision on 'Napalm girl' photo
